sourceMeaningMnemonic: In this <radical>building</radical> there's a <radical>small</radical> <radical>sun</radical> that's <radical>small</radical>. They keep this small, small sun inside of a <kanji>crevice</kanji>.
meaningInfo: You wouldn't want to keep a sun out in the open, even if it's small (and small). You'd put it inside something, like a crevice. Imagine walking into the building and seeing the small sun right inside, in a crevice.
readingMnemonic: They keep the sun in the <kanji>crevice</kanji> because this is a place where people <reading>ski</reading> (<ja>すき</ja>).
readingInfo: If the sun were out in the open, it'd melt all the snow, making it hard to ski here. So they hide the sun away in a crevice so people can ski.
